104.title: Gasoline Alley
104.author: King.

105.title: Gasoline Alley
105.author: King.
notes: Summary: Doc and his wife discuss the possible couples they could take with them for a night out, and decide to go out by themselves.

106.title: Gasoline Alley
106.author: King.
notes: Summary: Doc's going to drop a floater for the water hazard, and his foursome discusses the pros and cons.

107.title: Gasoline Alley

113.title: Gasoline Alley
113.author: King.

116.title: Gasoline Alley

117.title: Gasoline Alley

121.author: King.

notes: Summary: Doc comes home from work early and his wife has Christmas presents out that he mustn't see.

129.title: Gasoline Alley
129.author: King.
notes: Summary: Avery worries about his car, about the radiator cover and cracked cylinders.

130.title: Gasoline Alley
130.author: King.
notes: Summary: Bill doesn't know what to get Amy for Christmas; Walt witnesses his discomfort and rejoices at being single.

131.title: Gasoline Alley
131.author: King.
131.series: Dec. 19, 1919) "Avery Shops for Emily's Christmas Gift"
notes: Summary: Avery checks the housewares, perfume, lingerie, furniture and hosiery departments, and ends up buying a tube vulcanizer.

132.title: Gasoline Alley
132.author: King.
notes: Summary: Amy (Bill's wife), Emily Blimp (Avery's wife) and Doc's wife (she calls him "Doctor") discuss what to get for their husbands for Christmas.

133.title: Gasoline Alley
133.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Bill remarks on the price of a present, and starts an argument with Amy.

134.title: Gasoline Alley
134.author: King.
notes: Summary: People tell other people what they've bought for yet other people for Christmas.

135.title: Gasoline Alley
135.author: King.
notes: Summary: A gift comes after Christmas from somebody they forgot, and Avery has to rush to the post office and mail a return gift.

136.title: Gasoline Alley
136.author: King.
136.series: Dec. 27, 1919) "Making It Comfy for the Bunch"
notes: Summary: Walt's chinking the window cracks in his garage, but his friends are still complaining that it's too cold.

137.title: Gasoline Alley
137.author: King.
notes: Summary: Bill orders water at the bar, and pours some of his own liquor into it. The bartender asks for a taste.

138.title: Gasoline Alley
138.author: King.
notes: Summary: Walt has plenty of antifreeze in his radiator and doesn't have to worry about the cold, but he left the flap down and the engine overheats.

139.title: Gasoline Alley
139.author: King.
notes: Summary: Hank, who was supposed to have fixed the speeding ticket and didn't, now wants a favor from Walt.

140.title: Gasoline Alley
140.author: King.
140.series: Dec. 31, 1919) "Things Aren't the Same Any More"
notes: Summary: Bill, Avery and Doc bemoan the prospect of New Year's Eve without liquor; Walt is more optimistic.

141.title: Gasoline Alley
141.author: Frank King
notes: Reprints strips in color dating "from the 1920's and 30's, with the final page from 1941."

142.title: Gasoline Alley
142.author: Frank King
142.appears_in: p. 107 in The Smithsonian Collection of Newspaper Comics, ed. by Bill Blackbeard and Martin Williams (Washington, D.C. : Smithsonian Institution Press, 1977).
notes: Sunday episode.
While Walt changes a tire, Skeezix and Corky get lost, briefly.

143.title: Gasoline Alley
143.author: Frank King
143.series: 1930) "In the Style of the Old Woodcut Pictures"*
143.appears_in: p. 109 in The Smithsonian Collection of Newspaper Comics, ed. by Bill Blackbeard and Martin Williams (Washington, D.C. : Smithsonian Institution Press, 1977).
notes: Sunday episode.

144.title: Gasoline Alley
144.author: Frank King
144.appears_in: p. 108 in The Smithsonian Collection of Newspaper Comics, ed. by Bill Blackbeard and Martin Williams (Washington, D.C. : Smithsonian Institution Press, 1977).
notes: Sunday episode.

145.title: Gasoline Alley
145.author: by King
145.series: 1931) "A Boat Ride Trip to the Zoo, Toy Balloons, Ice Cream Cones and All"*
145.appears_in: p. 111 in The Smithsonian Collection of Newspaper Comics, ed. by Bill Blackbeard and Martin Williams (Washington, D.C. : Smithsonian Institution Press, 1977).
notes: Sunday episode, with a 1-tier bottom strip, "That Phoney Nickel."

146.title: Gasoline Alley
146.author: King
146.series: 1931) "He Chiseled Me Out of a Dime"*
146.appears_in: p. 112 in The Smithsonian Collection of Newspaper Comics, ed. by Bill Blackbeard and Martin Williams (Washington, D.C. : Smithsonian Institution Press, 1977).
notes: Sunday episode, with a 1-tier bottom strip, "That Phoney Nickel."

147.title: Gasoline Alley
147.author: by King
147.appears_in: p. 110 in The Smithsonian Collection of Newspaper Comics, ed. by Bill Blackbeard and Martin Williams (Washington, D.C. : Smithsonian Institution Press, 1977).
notes: Sunday episode, with a 1-tier bottom strip, "That Phoney Nickel."
Though the main strip is divided in 12 panels, it is really one large drawing.

148.title: Gasoline Alley
148.author: [No author]
notes: Reprints Sunday pages (some with toppers) featuring: Little Nemo in Slumberland (1905); Gasoline Alley (1934) Buck Rogers (1933); Dot and Dash, Polly and Her Pals (1927); Krazy Kat (1939); Prince Valiant (1938); The Kin-der-Kids (1906); Dingle-Hoofer and His Dog Adolf, The Katzenjammer Kids (1932); Mutt and Jeff (1918); Bringing Up Father (1918); Sappo, Thimble Theatre (1936); Napoleon (1939) 1. Newspapers
Sections, columns, etc.
Comics. 2. Calendars. I. [Each strip title] II. Pomegrante Calendars & Books. Call no.: Oversize PN6726.S8 1991

149.title: Gasoline Alley
149.author: by Frank King
149.series: 1936) "According to the Rules, You Can Lift It One Club Length Away"*
149.appears_in: reproduced on p. 68 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Doc's ball lands at the feet of a traffic cop, as he drives his golf ball across the country.

150.title: Gasoline Alley
150.author: by Frank King
150.series: 1936) "I'll Play While I Ride and Count My Strokes"*
150.appears_in: reproduced on p. 68 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Doc lands his ball in the bed of a truck, and accepts a ride as he continues his cross country golf drive.

151.title: Gasoline Alley
151.author: by Frank King
151.appears_in: reproduced on p. 68 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: In San Francisco, Doc begins driving his golf ball across the country.

152.title: Gasoline Alley
152.author: by Frank King
152.series: Sept. 9, 1936) "I Air-Mailed my Golf Ball in Nebraska"*
152.appears_in: reproduced on p. 69 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Doc Arrives in New York on his cross country golf drive.

153.title: Gasoline Alley
153.author: by King
notes: Newspaper reprints, copyright 1937.

154.title: Gasoline Alley
154.author: by King.
notes: Summary: Somehow it's Gootch's day with the car whenever there's a party.

155.title: Gasoline Alley
155.author: by Frank King.
notes: Scrapbooks of daily comic strips dated from June 4, 1945 to Dec. 31, 1958.

156.title: Gasoline Alley
156.author: King.
notes: Summary: Corky is taking Skeezix to see where he works and meet his boss.

157.title: Gasoline Alley
157.author: King.
157.series: Feb. 4, 1950) "Hey, What's On Your Mind? Startin' a Lunch Counter?"*
notes: Summary: Corky asks Pudge to show him the cuts of beef, how to buy vegetables, and how to figure portions.

158.title: Gasoline Alley
158.author: King.
158.series: Feb. 21, 1962) "Relax! Clovia and I Took Care of Him Hours Ago!"*
notes: Summary: After putting the pup in the basement, Skeezix later worries he might be too cold.

159.title: Gasoline Alley
159.author: King.
notes: Summary: Corky and Hope don't want the pup, and Skeezix and Nina begin to see why.

160.title: Gasoline Alley
160.author: King.
notes: Summary: Sam Smack is coming to identify his lost dog.

161.title: Gasoline Alley
161.author: King.
notes: Summary: The pup recognizes Sam, and Sam calls him "Shag."

162.title: Gasoline Alley
162.author: King.
162.series: Mar. 17, 1962) "Skeezix, It's Like He Was Taking One of the Children"*
notes: Summary: Sam Smack won't sell Shag, and leaves with the pup on a leash and Nina in tears.

163.title: Gasoline Alley
163.author: [No author]
163.series: 1969-1986) Gasoline Alley : scrapbooks of collected daily and Sunday newspaper comic strips.
notes: Artwork signed: Dick Moores; some Sunday strips signed Bill Perry.
Scrapbooks assembled by donor.
Dates collected in the 10 v. held are: 6-19-69 to 3-29-86. Not all Sunday strips included.

164.title: Gasoline Alley
164.author: by Dick Moores
notes: Reprints strips from June 13 to June 20, 1972.

165.title: Gasoline Alley
165.author: by Dick Moores
165.series: June 21 to July 6, 1972) "The Dire Straits of Stubbs"
notes: Reprints strips from June 21 to July 6, 1972.

166.title: Gasoline Alley
166.author: by Dick Moores
166.series: Mar. 22, 1976) "I Knew You Wouldn't Like My Room"*
166.appears_in: p. 11 of The Menomonee Falls Guardian, no. 146 (Aug. 1976).
notes: Summary: Clovia is moving out.

167.title: Gasoline Alley
167.author: by Dick Moores
167.series: Mar. 23, 1976) "We Just Want You To Be Happy, Clovia"*
167.appears_in: p. 11 of The Menomonee Falls Guardian, no. 146 (Aug. 1976).
notes: Summary: There's a line for the bathroom outside Clovia's new room.

168.title: Gasoline Alley
168.author: by Dick Moores
168.series: Mar. 24, 1976) "There Isn't a Lock in the Building that Works"*
168.appears_in: p. 11 of The Menomonee Falls Guardian, no. 146 (Aug. 1976).
notes: Summary: Clovia's lost her key, and Slim says not to worry.

169.title: Gasoline Alley
169.author: by Dick Moores
169.series: Mar. 25, 1976) "One Kook Who had This Room Hung His Stuff Outside the Window in Bags"*
169.appears_in: p. 11 of The Menomonee Falls Guardian, no. 146 (Aug. 1976).
notes: Summary: Clovia seems to have too much stuff for her room.

170.title: Gasoline Alley
170.author: by Dick Moores
170.series: Mar. 26, 1976) "It's Not Like I'm Moving to the End of the World, Mom"*
170.appears_in: p. 11 of The Menomonee Falls Guardian, no. 146 (Aug. 1976).
notes: Summary: Clovia says goodbye to her parents.

171.title: Gasoline Alley
171.author: by Dick Moores
171.series: Mar. 27, 1976) "I'll Put My Sewing Machine Here and My Desk Over There"*
171.appears_in: p. 11 of The Menomonee Falls Guardian, no. 146 (Aug. 1976).
notes: Summary: Nina stares into Clovia's empty room.

172.title: Gasoline Alley
172.author: by Dick Moores
notes: (Clovia's Apartment ; chapter 2)

173.title: Gasoline Alley
173.author: Dick Moores.
173.series: June 3, 1985) "I Warms! Th' Okay Cafe Do th' Cookin'!"*
notes: Summary: Rufus is sprucing up his house because Melba's coming to dinner. Joel didn't know Rufus could even cook.

174.title: Gasoline Alley
174.author: by Dick Moores.
notes: Summary: Because of the new tenant they have to keep the dogs on leashes; walking them's a problem because they're bigger than the kids.

175.title: Gasoline Alley
175.author: by Jim Scancarelli.
175.series: Jan. 13, 1987) "All We Has to Do Now is Fix the Doggy Door!"*
notes: Summary: First Rufus and Joel fix Walt's exercise bike.

176.title: Gasoline Alley
176.author: Scancarelli.
176.series: Mar. 21, 1987) "I'm In Pain! How Long are You Going to Let Me Sit Here?"*
notes: Summary: Chipper's waiting impatiently in a wheelchair for Sloan.

177.title: Gasoline Alley
177.author: Scancarelli.
notes: Summary: Mr. Blink leaves Joel and Rufus in a huff, but forgets his camera.

178.title: Gasoline Alley
178.author: Scancarelli.
178.series: Nov. 3, 1987) "Sorry Teeka Doesn't Like My Cooking"*
notes: Summary: Teeka's not well, probably it's something she ate.

179.title: Gasoline Alley
179.author: Scancarelli.
179.series: Nov. 5, 1987) "I Guess My Cooking is OK After All!"*
notes: Summary: Teeka is feeling better. She comes to the table hungry, and wants seconds.

180.title: Gasoline Alley
180.author: Scancarelli.
180.series: Jan. 16, 1989) "If That Burglar's Still Here, He's Stone Deaf"
notes: Summary: Walt and Avery have collided while looking for a burglar.

181.title: Gasoline Alley
181.author: Scancarelli.
notes: Summary: What a vacation, she lost her ring and his metal detector was a failure.

182.title: Gasoline Alley
182.author: Scancarelli.
182.series: Apr. 14, 2004) "A Secret is Something You Tell Just One Person at a Time!"*
notes: Summary: Walt is trying to figure out something about Col. Coda, Mme Octave, and the birth of Skeezix; Phyllis tells him to wait.

183.title: Gas
notes: See also Gasoline
